intro: Dunalia australis, commonly known as the Australian dunalia, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and small, pale yellow to greenish flowers. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs. Dunalia australis is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
